Dear Mr. Zolman:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 12/30/2020.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation, Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 For repeat violations note why the previous CAP failed.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12312 Foster parent training.
(4) At least 1 adult member of the household shall have training
in and maintain a current certification in first aid from the
American Heart Association or the American Red Cross or other
institution approved by the department.
Two of three licensed foster home files were found not to have verification of First
Aid training and one of the two did not have verification of CPR training. REPEAT
VIOLATION, 10/15/19, and corresponding CAP, 10/18/19. The agency must
report why the previous CAP was not successful.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(e) A list of all children currently placed in the home.
(g) A copy of the foster parent /agency agreement signed by
the foster parent and the borrowing agency.
(h) A copy of the current children's foster home license
application and children's foster home licensing transaction
record documents from the certifying agency.
(e) One of three borrowed home files reviewed did not contain a current placement
list.
(g) One of three borrowed home files reviewed did not contain a parent agency
agreement.
(h) One of three borrowed home files reviewed did not contain a current application.
R 400.12403 Policy and procedures.
(2) The policies and procedures shall cover at least all of the
following areas:
(i) Service plans.
4

Two of two closed foster care files reviewed were found to have not uploaded three
of four parent agency treatment plans, therefore signatures could not be verified.
Additionally, one parent agency treatment plan was provided at the time of the
inspection but was only signed by one of the two caregivers.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(3) When case responsibility changes from 1 child placing
agency to another child placing agency, a modified service plan
must be completed within 30 calendar days of the change in
agency responsibility if no other plan is done within 30 days.
The plan shall address why the agency responsibility changed
and whether there are any modifications to existing service
plans.
One applicable closed foster care file did not have a 30-day modified service plan
from the time the agency received the case through the first 30 days. REPEAT
VIOLATION, 10/15/19, and corresponding CAP, 10/18/19. The agency must
report why the previous CAP was not successful.
R 400.12422 Foster care record.
(3) The record shall contain all of the following information:
(e) Change of placement documentation as required by R
400.12405.
(e) Two of two closed foster care files reviewed contained closing DHHS 69 Action
Summaries that were completed late (beyond the three days noted in policy) and left
the documentation of services and ‘needs to be met and provision of those services’
section blank. REPEAT VIOLATION, 10/15/19, and corresponding CAP, 10/18/19.
The agency must report why the previous CAP was not successful in fully
addressing this requirement. The last report cited missing DHHS 69s.
R 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation.
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a written
adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family signing an
adoption application and prior to approving a family for adoption.
5

Three of six adoptive family evaluations were observed to be late. These evaluations
were observed to be about six weeks, two months, and four months late
respectively. REPEAT VIOLATION, 10/15/19, and corresponding CAP, 10/18/19.
The agency must report why the previous CAP was not successful.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-05 Case Documentation.
The agency provided documents for multiple files at the time of inspection that
were not uploaded prior. The agency must maintain all case documentation in the
child's electronic record in MiSACWIS in a timely fashion.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meetings.
Two of two closed foster care files reviewed were found to be missing FTMs
required by policy for quarterly updates, case plan development, discharge
planning, and case closure.
FOM 801 Medical Passports.
Two of two closed foster care files reviewed were found to be missing medical
passports for the time they held the foster care cases.
Adoption Contract– MARE Related Responsibilities: The Contractor shall
ensure that a supervisor attends the regionally based MARE sessions on changes
to MARE processes and services. This individual shall then be responsible to
disseminate MARE information and material to appropriate Contractor staff.
The agency did not ensure that a supervisor attend the required MARE sessions.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
The agency was advised to ensure that supporting documents are uploaded to all
licensed home files. Particularly, in regard to one file where the foster parents were
licensed together and then separated, the foster mother continued the license in a
6

new provider record in MiSACWIS. The agency should ensure all applicable
documents are uploaded under her new provider record.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
Agency should upload all supporting documentation to the provider record for direct
consent adoptions to maintain consistent practice through all files.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment or corporal punishment
during this licensing period.
The agency has submitted no other acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The DCWL Field Analyst report contained no safety alerts or concerns, therefore no
follow up was required. There are ten violations in this Interim Report, compared to
13 in the last Renewal Report.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
